subject: Economics
subcategory: Economic Crises That Shook the World
title: The New Deal: FDR's Economic Experiment
description: A short lesson to help you apply The New Deal: FDR's Economic Experiment.

hook.text: When FDR took office in 1933, 25% of Americans were unemployed. He promised 'bold, persistent experimentation.

buildup.text: In his first 100 days, FDR created the CCC, WPA, SEC, FDIC, and Social Security.

discovery.text: The New Deal put millions to work building roads, dams, bridges, and parks. Many are still in use 90 years later.

twist.text: FDR cut spending in 1937, trying to balance the budget.

climax.text: The New Deal didn't fully end the Depression â€” WWII spending did.

punchline.text: The New Deal didn't cure the Depression. It proved the patient could survive.

quiz.question: What lesson came from the Roosevelt Recession of 1937?
options: Cutting government spending during a fragile recovery can cause the economy to crash again
